children.subject: Connector courses are offered through many different department. The hosting department would determine enrollment procedures. CS 88 is not being offered in F17 so I don't have any other information here.
I'm not sure if this post also refers to the connector courses for C8. What is the procedure for enrolling in those? I can't seem to find them listed anywhere for Fall 2017.
For 70, you can show up to whatever section you want, even if (like in the old system) you enrolled in a specific one.

This means that I shouldn't need to phase I CS 70, correct? I am an LS rising sophomore, undeclared. I was only planning on signing up in Phase I to get a good discussion time, but since this isn't an issue anymore, I was thinking that I may as well wait.

**UPDATE 4/18:  To be able to implement this, we will have to create a faux discussion and/or lab section that will be offered at no particular time and in no particular room that all students who enroll in CS 1xx will select.  The actual sections at specific times in specific locations will still exist at classes.berkeley.edu but not in calcentral.  The faux section will create no conflicts and it will have at least as many seats as the lecture so the waitlist can still be processed in lecture waitlist order.  It should be possible to enroll in any non-cross-listed CS course starting between 9am and noon on Wednesday 4/19.

When adding CS 70, both using the search and by entering the class number, CalCentral does not let it go through. The error shown is:

"Select your required discussion section"

I understand that discussion sections aren't in CalCentral, but it seems as if it requires  a selection to go through. There's one empty section, but clicking that does not fix the problem. Screenshot attached.
This post is about lower divisions. I think you already have those completed. Try @3831
How does the faux discussion work? I do not see any faux discussions for any of the classes I am in.

CS70 Enrollment - CalCentral Error?

I tried changing my discussion section for CS70 however I just get this, did anyone get the same problem?

I just get this, did anyone get the same problem?

When I try to enroll in 61C, it waitlists me because I do not meet the reserve requirements.  Right now I have declared a major other than CS, but will declare CS as my double after this semester. Will I still be able to get into 61C for this fall?
CS61c automatically waitlists me regardless of the discussion/lab section I'm choosing. I'm a current freshman who will declare LS CS after this semester.

history.content:
See https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower

For CS 70 and C8 (aka DS8) in F17, students will use calcentral to enroll in the lecture and not to choose discussion sections (for 70) or labs (for c8).  Discussion/lab sections still exist and will be visible in classes.berkeley.edu .  Since these sections won’t automatically show up in schedule planner, etc., students can manually block off a specific discussion section time in their schedule as desired.  This change was made to avoid students being bumped to the end of the lecture waitlist when changing sections for a waitlisted course. The instructor is likely to speak briefly during the first lecture about discussion section attendance.  Basically, as long as fire code isn’t ignored you’ll probably be good. 

**UPDATE 4/18:  To be able to implement the above, we will have to create a faux discussion and/or lab section that will be offered at no particular time and in no particular room that all students who enroll in CS 1xx will select.  The actual sections at specific times in specific locations will still exist at classes.berkeley.edu but not in calcentral.  The faux section will create no conflicts and it will have at least as many seats as the lecture so the waitlist can still be processed in lecture waitlist order.  It should be possible to enroll in any non-cross-listed CS course starting between 9am and noon on Wednesday 4/19.

**UPDATE 4/20:  COMPSCI c8 is now set up able available for enrollments.

All enrollments for CS c8/STAT c8/Info c8 will happen via the COMPSCI section. No one will be able to enroll in STAT or INFO.  Enrollment will prioritize first and second year (as of F17) undergrads through the last phase 2 undergrad appointment slot in early August.

For 61ABC students will sign up for labs and discussions in calcentral. With two separate secondary sections and such large lectures, it seemed too complicated to have none of them pre-assigned through your choices and campus systems.

**UPDATE 7/26:  CS61A has 9 new sections and the enrollment limit has been been increased by ~ 320.  Students who blocked from enrolling now only because of lab and/or discussion section choice should explore whether dropping and re-adding to new and open sections will increase their chances for being enrolled quickly. After August 1st, all students will have access regardless of major standing or years at Cal, so undeclared L&S students, transfer students and EECS majors should act soon if they want to have prioritized access to these new sections.  An email will go out later today with this information to students currently on the 61A waitlist.
